    • Constructor Detail

      • InputHandler

        protected InputHandler(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                       @Nullable
                       java.io.PrintStream errorStream,
                       @Nullable
                       java.lang.String errorMessage)
        When you create the anonymous class extending this one you'll send 2 important values used during the input phase..
        Parameters:
        inputStream - This is the InputStream used to read datas.
        errorStream - This is where the error log will be printed.
        errorMessage - This String identifies the default error that can come from the inpuit phase.

      • InputHandler

        protected InputHandler(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        This alternative form of the constructor is called whenever the input does not require an error handling.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - This is the InputStream used to read datas.

    • Method Detail

      • readValue

        public static double readValue(java.util.Scanner scan,
                               java.lang.String request,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String error,
                               @Nullable
                               Validator<java.lang.Double> validator)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Mostly used to read values while implementing an InputHandler
        Parameters:
        scan - is the way used to read input doubles
        request - is the prompt sent to users to requesting an input
        error - is the error message threw back to execute(DataReader)
        validator - if it's not null it defines its own condition to validate the input
        Returns:
        It returns the read value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - It's threw to execute(DataReader) whenever the input it's not valid

      • readValue

        public static double readValue(java.util.Scanner scan,
                               java.lang.String request)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Simpler version of readValue(Scanner, String, String), it does not require an error message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        readValue(Scanner, String, String)

      • execute

        public void execute(DataReader reader)
        This is the access point of the input phase, call this method to instantiate it. This method is designed for handling 2 types of error that can occur form the input sentences: - If the DataReader#run() method returns false we accomplish that the default error occurred. - To print out errors of any other form the run() method'll throw back any kind of Exception
        Parameters:
        reader - Is the instance containing the DataReader.run(Scanner) method called to read data
